lead_paragraph: SCHWARZ--Patricia, died peacefully at home on May 26, 2016. She was born in Michigan and came to New York to study at The Juilliard School, from which she graduated with an Artists Diploma and B.S. Degree. For 25 years, she was Arts Coordinator of the America-Israel Cultural Foundation. In 1986 the US-China Arts Exchange at Columbia University sent her for a month in China to observe western and traditional Chinese music in the major conservatories. For many years, Mrs. Schwarz was a member of the Music Critics Association of North America and the American Society for Jewish Music. She leaves her beloved son Jack; grandchildren Daniel, Emily and Brian; and her great-grandchildren Jacob, Annie and Sebastian. In 1999 she lost her beloved younger son, K. Robert Schwarz. In lieu of flowers, contributions in her memory may be made to the Queens College Foundation, Queens College- CUNY, 65-30 Kissena Blvd, Flushing, NY 11367-1597 for the Boris Schwarz Scholarship Fund and the K. Robert Schwarz Archive of Music. 1/3
